node.statement: Step 1.3.1 (Exponential 6j asymptotics): For fixed q > 0, q â‰  1, the quantum 6j symbol {j1 j2 j3; j4 j5 j6}_q with all spins proportional to a scaling parameter n has exponential growth rate equal to the volume of the associated generalized hyperbolic tetrahedron: lim (1/n) log |{nj1,...,nj6}_q| = Vol_hyp(Delta(q,j_i)). For q > 1 and the regular tetrahedron (all j_i = j), Vol_hyp > 0 giving exponential growth; for 0 < q < 1, Vol_hyp < 0 giving exponential decay. References: Taylor-Woodward (Selecta Math 2005), Costantino (Geom Topol 2007), Belletti-Yang (J Topology 2025).
